Filters function¶

toto.filters.bandpass_filter module¶

Creates Fourier low, high, or bandpass filter.

  • lower cut-off (s) is minimum period filter cutoff

  • upper cut-off (s) is maximum period filter cutoff

lower cut-off set < (2*delt) for no cutoff at high freq end upper cut-off set > (length(data)*delt) for no cutoff at low freq end

toto.filters.bandpass_filter.bandpass_filter(input_array, args={'lower cut-off (s)': 0.0, 'upper cut-off (s)': 0.0})[source]¶

toto.filters.cyclone_filter module¶

Remove cyclone evnt from a timeseries based on its position. Needs:

  • lon/lat

  • NOAA Cyclone file (i.e IBTrACS.ALL.v04r00.nc)

Inputs:

  • radius of maximum wind

  • minimun category (default: 1)

  • mask radius from centre (default 500m)

  • time to mask before and after a cyclone passage (default 0.5 day)

toto.filters.cyclone_filter.cyclone_filter(input_array, args={'Lat': 0.0, 'Lon': 0.0, 'Mode': {'from centre': True, 'from wind radius': False}, 'cyclone file': '/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/IBTrACS.ALL.v04r00.nc', 'mask radius from centre': 500, 'minimun category': 1, 'radius of maximum wind': 0.0, 'time to mask after a cyclone passage (in days)': 0.5, 'time to mask before a cyclone passage (in days)': 0.5})[source]¶

toto.filters.despike_phasespace3d module¶

This subroutine excludes spike noise from Acoustic Doppler Velocimetry (ADV) data using phase-space method, using modified Goring and Nikora (2002) method by Nobuhito Mori (2005). Further modified by Joseph Ulanowski to remove offset in output (2014).

toto.filters.despike_phasespace3d.despike_phasespace3d(input_array, args={})[source]¶
toto.filters.despike_phasespace3d.func_excludeoutlier_ellipsoid3d(xi, yi, zi, theta)[source]¶

% % This program excludes the points outside of ellipsoid in two- % dimensional domain

toto.filters.detrend module¶

Detrending a signal Methods:

  • Linear (default)

  • Constant

see https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.signal.detrend.html for more info

toto.filters.detrend.detrend(input_array, args={'Type': {'constant': False, 'linear': True}})[source]¶

toto.filters.lanczos_filter module¶

Apply a low pass 1st or 2nd order lanczos filter

toto.filters.lanczos_filter.lanczos_filter(input_array, args={'Type': {'lanczos lowpas 1st order': True, 'lanczos lowpas 2nd order': False}, 'window': 0})[source]¶
toto.filters.lanczos_filter.lanczos_lowpass_filter_coeffs(cf, m, normalize=True)[source]¶

return the convolution coefficients for low pass lanczos filter.

Cf: float

Cutoff frequency expressed as a ratio of a Nyquist frequency.

M: int

Size of filtering window size.

pdb.set_trace() Results: list

Coefficients of filtering window.

toto.filters.lanczos_filter.lanczos_lowpass_first_order(data, window, dt=1, order=5)[source]¶
toto.filters.lanczos_filter.lanczos_lowpass_second_order(data, window, dt=1, order=5)[source]¶

Inpulse response filter

toto.filters.moving_average module¶

Moving average Methods (see https://numpy.org/doc/stable/reference/generated/numpy.convolve.html):

  • Valid

  • Same

Inputs:

  • number of point to use

toto.filters.moving_average.moving_average(input_array, args={'Mode': {'same': True, 'valid': False}, 'N-Points filter': 0})[source]¶

toto.filters.spike_removal module¶

Remove spikes Spikes can be found using find_peaks: see https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.signal.find_peaks.html

toto.filters.spike_removal.spike_removal(input_array, args={'distance': 0.0, 'height': 0.0, 'plateau_size': 0, 'prominence': 0.0, 'rel_height': 0.0, 'threshold': 0.0, 'width': 0.0, 'wlen': 0.0})[source]¶
